Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Tjesbastperet (?) with painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face, uncrossed arms in relief holding a black hoe and the cord of a seed-basket which is represented hanging down the flat back, the front of the legs is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs within a border.
Curator's comments: Shabtis of same owner in Liverpool, World Museum , identified as belonging to Tjesbastetperet A, daughter of Osorkon II: G Janes, The Shabti Collections 6, pp. 174-5.
